mdRecord.dcterms:title: WSLS-TV reporter Bill Mason interviews Maine Governor Kenneth M. Curtis; Andrew Pickens Miller and Senator Henry Evans Howell, Jr., attend a U.S. Democratic Party rally
mdRecord.dcterms:description: WSLS-TV reporter Bill Mason interviews Governor Kenneth M. Curtis of Maine. Governor Curtis comments on third party presidential candidate George C. Wallace, saying America will never belong to Wallace's American Independent Party. Footage switches to Andrew Pickens Miller, Virginia attorney general candidate, and Senator Henry Evans Howell, Jr., at a U.S. Democratic Party rally in support of presidential candidate Hubert H. Humphrey. Miller orates at the podium at the front of the room as Senator Howell watches, laughing and smiling.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Presidents--United States--Election--1968
